name: SEER Regional Nodes
title: SEER Regional Nodes
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in SEER Mets.

**Note 2:**  The regional nodes are inguinal or femoral:  inguinal, NOS; deep inguinal, NOS; Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller (highest deep inguinal); and superficial inguinal (femoral) and regional lymph nodes [NOS].

**Note 3:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and regional lymph node detail are available, record the code with regional lymph node detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. FIGO Stage IVA is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  Code SEER Regional Nodes based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage IVA only if it is known that the FIGO stage value is assigned because of regional lymph node involvement.
rows:
None

No regional lymph node involvement

Regional lymph node(s) involved only

REGIONAL Lymph Nodes (including bilateral or contralateral nodes)

Inguinal, NOS:
    Deep, NOS:
        Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller (highest deep inguinal)
    Superficial (femoral)
    FIGO Stage III

Regional lymph node(s), NOS

Bilateral/contralateral regional lymph node(s)
FIGO Stage IVA

Regional lymph node(s) with extracapsular spread

Fixed or ulcerated regional lymph nodes

FIGO Stage III (IIIA, IIIB, IIIC)  

FIGO Stage IVA based on regional lymph node involvement

Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1 (N1a, N1b, N1 [NOS]), N2 (N2a, N2b, N2c, N2 [NOS]), or N3

Unknown; regional lymph nodes not stated
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
